review_title: Some locations are better than others
job_title: Program Assistant II in Toronto, ON
pros: Some co-workers are really helpful. A l ot of them really want to help you with your work and to succeed. The hours are also really good. The basic 9-5
cons: Upper management, union, and absolutely no job security

pros: Great colleagues, wonderful clients, close to public transit
cons: Poor management, CEO never present, no focus on management compensation

review_title: Train Wreck - Sinking Ship - Stay far away!!!
pros: Most staff who are there have stayed there and are committed to helping the most vulnerable people. They have put up with some very uncertain times and had no leadership since 2010.
cons: No strategic direction, no leadership, CEO is a dictator, compensation is poor and non-competitive, discrimatory practices, no transparency, seriously needs to have audit as very bad practices taking place with the new CEO.  CHS is a scam!

review_title: CHS used to be a great place to work!
pros: Was once socially inclusive, and a great place to move up the ranks!
cons: What was once a grass roots social service agency is now a corporate profits driven organization led by senior managers only interested in padding their wallets. Such a shame.

pros: Never took my work home. Solid 9 to 5 if thats what you like.
cons: Senior management is so far removed and disconnected from day to day operations. CEO is clueless and goes ahead with terrible plans that no one recommend. Every VP and senior director either quit or resigned in the space of a few months because they were all fed up or dared to challenge the CEO.
